Title: [L01] Initial configured markets might not be Uniswap V2 pairs
Content:
The entire Open Price Feed view based in the `UniswapAnchoredView.sol`, `UniswapConfig.sol` and `UniswapLib.sol` files work under the assumption that [all market addresses set during construction](https://github.com/compound-finance/open-oracle/blob/d0a0d0301bff08457d9dfc5861080d3124d079cd/contracts/Uniswap/UniswapConfig.sol#L464-L493) behave as [Uniswap V2 pairs](https://github.com/Uniswap/uniswap-v2-core/blob/v1.0.1/contracts/UniswapV2Pair.sol). However, this assumption is never programmatically enforced in the audited contracts. Markets set during construction should only comply with the [`IUniswapV2Pair` interface](https://github.com/compound-finance/open-oracle/blob/d0a0d0301bff08457d9dfc5861080d3124d079cd/contracts/Uniswap/UniswapLib.sol#L62-L66), and their final addresses are entirely dictated by the deployer of the `UniswapAnchoredView` contract.


Once the view is deployed, users can easily verify that the markets configured are indeed Uniswap V2 pairs by querying the [`getTokenConfig` function](https://github.com/compound-finance/open-oracle/blob/d0a0d0301bff08457d9dfc5861080d3124d079cd/contracts/Uniswap/UniswapConfig.sol#L647) with indexes from 0 to 29, ensuring the received addresses are listed in [uniswap.info](https://uniswap.info).


If this is the systemâ€™s expected behavior, consider explicitly stating it in contracts or external, user-friendly, documentation. Otherwise, consider programmatically enforcing that market addresses set during construction are indeed the expected Uniswap V2 pairs.
